title: Supply-Chain for Agriculture
description: 現地での取引はほとんどが一連の仲買人によって行われているため、農産物の価格が高騰しています。トレーサビリティーの問題。

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal addresses the challenge with a proven business model adopted for Africa. Traceability of food products coupled with B2B supply-chain on Cardano.

The value added to Cardano ecosystem is through growing transactions and adoption in Africa which is in line with the challenge.

The proposal is written with passion and focus, however it is lacking estimates on the actual number of users/vendors/volume or transactions. Given the very detailed overall proposal, I will not deduct from the score.

The proposal has a good opportunity to scale and be utilized across the continent.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposing team has a good mix of tech, business and marketing with the downside being relatively young for such an ambitious project. The profiles of the team are presented with public Linkedin profiles.

The presented plan is complex with a lot of experts to be hired for execution and delivery raising concerns if critical positions could not be filled (Plutus dev for example).

The budget is well thought, broken down into time frames with required resources. Overall a solid overview of the costs, manpower and resources needed.

The proposer has touched on risks, but did not elaborate in depth. For an operation of such magnitude (hiring 10+ people, offices and equipment) the risks are high: manpower (availability, retention etc.), over-the-budget costs, delays, no cooperation from vendors/government bodies etc.

If all goes according to the plan, it is possible that the project will be delivered. However, It might be worthwhile to consider smaller steps or have more substance to start with. For example, make an app first, have a number of vendors ready to join etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has a clear roadmap, steps, budget, time estimate and deliverables.

The goal is clear, deliver traceability of food products coupled with B2B supply-chain on Cardano. 

The problem to be addressed and solution is clear, expensive food due to middleman.

The potential risks and challenges are not particularity addressed. It would be beneficial to see the potential roadblocks and ways to mitigate them, such as wrong time estimates, lack of hires or similar.

Expansion on the Metrics/KPI to measure the success would be beneficial, such as expected number of users, volumes, value.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a well written proposal that presented a problem with a clear solution to the challenge but will  benefit more if the milestones are broken down into smaller chunks and spread across future funds as milestones are achieved.Doing this will help in cutting down the requested amount and increase its chances of being funded.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal did a great job of providing verifiable experience with links with a clear implementation plan.
The proposal would benefit from cutting down the implementation plan to more manageable chunks as it seems bloated in its current form.
An example is only addressing "1. Customer Development and Recruiting " and "2. Product Development" in one funding round , then applying for more funding as needed.This will help in the feasibility and funding of the project considering that other funds will be funded in the same challenge.

Timeline provided for onboarding  and development seem to be understated speaking from a software developers point of view (15 years developing Softwares and high TPS services).

Considering the above , i can neither agree nor disagree on the implementation of this proposal to success in its current state.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did a great job of providing auditableTimelines ,milestones and cost implications.
Though , Implementation plan seems too small for the amount of work tat will be required to take this solution to market.
I believe these are fixable issues for subsequent funding rounds.
 I agree that the proposal can be audited .

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this a great project which fits in perfectly to address the challenge! With Africa's main commodity being in the ag sector, it would be able to utilize Blockchain technology, as it was ordinally designed. I think the biggest challenge is getting the local producer to agree/adopt taking payment in $ADA. But with the recent agreements Cardano has made with the Ethiopian government (as stated in the proposal), I think it'd help give confidence, plus a easy conversation to local fiat, would further help give the producer peace of mind.
f6_assessments.q1:
I was really on the fence on giving this section a 5 or 4 start rating because of the existing infrastructure (push-back) that is already in place. I think it's going to be hard to cut out the middle-man because they hold a lot of influence many different aspects of getting the products from the field to the actual customers. But I also know, nothing will change unless we change it, and I know with the right team, anything is possible! From looking over the profiles of the team, I see that they each bring something different to the table. And each of talents will be needed to develop this platform. 
I'm not sure if the timeline it completely feasible, but any project of this magnitude is going to run in to unforeseen problems.
I really can't comment on the price of certain developers, because I think it varies on location, but I think the budget is reasonable as it was written.
So for all that I've listed, I decided on a 5 star rating with the hopes that this can go forward...
f6_assessments.q2:
I kind of listed my reasoning why I think this project is doable, but I'd just like to comment on the need for like projects that end up being a win-win for all involved. 
The 5 star rating was giving by the many different mile stones and the very rational thinking when the proposal was put together. If funded, I think the community will be able to follow along to see the progress and know before to long whether this idea/project will become a success...

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal speaks very well with the objective of this challenge, because it intends to create an alternative way of commercializing agricultural products, which involves blockchain and possibly ada. This way would be through an application, as I understand it, in which the products would be tracked by token, and the main objective would be to make the purchase and sale of such products more direct, because according to what is said the large number intermediaries between a product and its consumer is one of the factors that make things more expensive on the continent. Therefore, creating a more direct way of marketing would certainly benefit the local population, and engaging token, blockchain and ada would add value to the Cardano ecosystem in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1: We know who the 3 team members are in a very detailed way, while they have attached the link to their linkedin profiles in the proposal. We also know that they intend to hire other professionals, necessary for the good development of the project, as mentioned during the proposal description. And we can also understand who would be hired according to the stage in which the project is, by detailing the distribution of funding money. Therefore, it is very solid that the team is aware of the project's needs, in addition to the fact that one of the members of the fixed team (Mearaf Tadewos) is a developer, and details the project in a very technical way. In this way, a lot of confidence and credibility is given to the team, which demonstrates that it has the knowledge and ability to manage the next hired and, therefore, carry out a successful project. As I mentioned, the monetary division is highly detailed, and we have a lot of information regarding the roadmap. Despite being an extensive and complex project, the proposal leaves everything well explained, so the way forward is palpable and reliable, in my opinion.
f6_assessments.q2: I found it interesting how extensively detailed what each phase of the project involves. Research, contact with potential customers, followed by product development, adoption and improvement are explained in smaller terms, enabling us to fully understand how the steps to be taken to implement the project would be. In step 3, however, it would be beneficial if they explained better which marketing channel they intend to adopt, because this part of the disclosure is one of the most important for the project's success and we need to understand it more deeply. The team specifies what challenges would be faced during the development of the project and by what metrics success would be measured, which would make it easier for the community to follow the progress of things.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal deal with a very important issue and a big challenge across the supply chains in Africa which are highly inefficient and unjust for the farmers. In this respect, it is well on the target of the challenge and well done on the initiative. 

When I was at Earthwrom.org, I worked for a couple of years on a related model for Indonesia but also evaluated other locations including in Africa such as Ivory Cost. I am well aware of the importance of such a solution but also of its complexity. Therefore, I think the problem and the solution should have much more details to show that you fully analyzed the challenge. 

Having adoptions by the farmers, overcoming logistics (certification, packaging, storing, and transfer, product quality, organic vs not organic), and selling to B2B clients, different types of agriculture products, nationally and internationally is quite a complex ecosystem. It is not clear from the solution how you are going to approach those issues in your plan and where is your key focus.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal suggests that stage 1 is to have market research with clients to understand their needs and discuss with them possible solutions. This is a very important step and I believe the proposal should have focused mainly on this part for now. Without this analysis, it is difficult to plan the next stages and define the product which in my view is still not very clear. 

Being a mentor for startups (i.e. with seedstars.com, GivingWay.com) I do believe more analysis is needed to give confidence that the plan is feasible.  

Regarding the budget well done for aiming to raise part of the budget from other sources as well as aiming to become profitable. However, the budget plan for me is also not clear, why for example the first 3 months focus on legal consulting and quality assurance? And how it connected to stage 1 in the overall plan? The separation of the budget to 3,6 and 12 months is not clear. For example: "customer service officer $8,500 for 12 months" does it mean that the position starts at the first month and for 12 months? If yes, than the 3 months budget should include also this item. This is relevant for all the other expenses. 

Finally, key team members seem great with complimentary experience (good to have the LinkedIn profile). It would have been helpful to have more information in the proposal about each one, position, and relevant experience for the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
You wrote in the proposal that "Fortunately enough, risks in the space are quite a few and at the minimum level, most likely not to happen."  I am not sure how you got to this conclusion as I do believe there are many risks around agriculture supply chains, starting with one of the key challenges you are trying to solve which is reducing the number of middlemen. Those middlemen normally provide logistics, cash flow, sales, or agriculture supporting products (seeds, chemicals) which are not easy to replace in such a complex supply chain.  

Deliverable could be clearer. For example, what does it mean mass scaling (customers, the volume of products sold, use of technology, range of products)? 
It is not clear what are the deliverable and metrics after 3, 6 or 12 months.

solution: CardanoブロックチェーンベースのWebアプリケーションとTelegramボットによるB2Bサプライチェーン。
experience: Full-Stack & Mobile App Eng, tested Plutus playground, B.SC in Computer Science, 4.5 years, key connections.Solidityのスマートコントラクト。
